intro: Oxymeris barbinervis, commonly known as the slender mangrove, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Arecaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves with a distinctive barbed venation pattern. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are typically borne on the trunk and branches. Oxymeris barbinervis is adapted to brackish and saline environments, making it a common species in coastal mangrove ecosystems. Its unique morphology and ecological role contribute to its importance in tropical coastal habitats.
